item.title: Adobe rolls out more generative AI features to Illustrator and Photoshop
item.description:
Adobe is introducing some new tools and generative AI features to its Illustrator and Photoshop design software that aim to help speed up creative workflows. The most notable updates are coming to Illustrator courtesy of Adobe’s new Firefly Vector 2 AI model, which is available in public beta starting today.

Firefly Vector 2 powers new Illustrator features like Generative Shape Fill, which allows users to add detailed vectors to shapes via descriptive text prompts. The updated model also improves the Text to Pattern beta feature, which can be used to create scalable, customized vector patterns for things like wallpapers; and Style Reference, which generates outputs that mirror existing styles.

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Jess Weatherbed

item.title: Farmblox puts the control into farmers’ hands with its AI-powered sensor-reading platform
item.description:
Nathan Rosenberg, the founder of farm automation platform Farmblox, said if there is one thing to know about trying to sell technology to farmers, it’s that you can’t tell them what to do. “[Farmers] are multigenerational,” Rosenberg told TechCrunch. “It is not a profession, it’s more a community, a way of life, and you need […]

item.title: QA Wolf secures $36M to grow its app QA-testing suite
item.description:
Quality assurance in the app development world is a necessary, but often resource-draining, undertaking. According to Statista, 23% of companies’ annual IT budgets are allocated to in-house or third-party contracted QA and testing. The stakes are high. In a survey by QA software-testing company QualiTest Group, 88% of app users said that they’d abandon apps […]

item.title: Adobe releases new Firefly AI tools for Illustrator and Photoshop
item.description:
Adobe released new Firefly tools for Photoshop and Illustrator on Tuesday, offering graphic designers more ways to use the company’s in-house AI models. Adobe’s new features let creative workers describe what they want with brief prompts, and receive AI generated textures or images that could otherwise take hours to create. As Adobe doubles down on […]

item.title: UK school reprimanded for unlawful use of facial recognition technology
item.description:
An English school has been reprimanded by U.K. regulators after it used facial recognition technology without getting opt-in consent from students.
